newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Qantas shares dip on cloudy outlook.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Qantas shares dip on cloudy outlook.

text.p: Shares in Qantas Airways Ltd were nearly three percent lower in early trading after the airline on Thursday issued a cautious outlook for the 1996/97 (June 30) year despite forecasting a higher profit.
At 11.45 a.m. (0145 GMT), Qantas shares were seven cents lower at A$2.07 with 2.9 million shares traded.
"There seems to be some negative sentiment around. There is quite a bit of selling, but there does not seem to be too many buyers out there," said one Sydney-based trader.

Qantas, 25 percent owned by British Airways PLc, reported on Thursday a 37 percent rise in net profit to A$246 million for the year to June 30, 1996 and tipped a higher profit for the year ahead, although this would be largely due to more cost cuts and lower market share.
